content:
• Friday, September 23, 2011
  • KSS

    Kohl's (KSS +3.5%) outperformed today after Citi's Deborah Weinswig gave a thumbs-up to its...

    Kohl's (KSS +3.5%) outperformed today after Citi's Deborah Weinswig gave a thumbs-up to its Jennifer Lopez and Marc Anthony apparel lines. Weinswig thinks the products could generate $520M/year in sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • CLX

    Clorox (NYSE:CLX) drops 3.8% AH on news of Carl Icahn withdrawing his nominees for the company's...

    Clorox (NYSE:CLX) drops 3.8% AH on news of Carl Icahn withdrawing his nominees for the company's board. Icahn had sought to replace Clorox's board with the goal of putting the company up for sale, and barring that, acquiring it for $78/share.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) gains 16.2% after Stifel's Aaron Rackers starts coverage on the company...

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) gains 16.2% after Stifel's Aaron Rackers starts coverage on the company with a Buy and $27 PT. Rackers thinks Fusion-io's software will allow its flash memory modules to maintain a technology lead over rival hardware, and expects the products to see broader adoption in time. Going into today, FIO had fallen 40% in September. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • AATI

    Advanced Analogic (AATI +2.7%) gains after the chipmaker files a petition for an arbitration...

    Advanced Analogic (AATI +2.7%) gains after the chipmaker files a petition for an arbitration ruling requiring Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS) to go through with its planned acquisition of the company. Skyworks has issued formal notices of breach to Advanced Analogic, and the resulting crash in the latter's shares suggests investors don't expect the deal to occur.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • DG

    Dollar stores move up after a Citi analysis says they should benefit from a focus on trade-down...

    Dollar stores move up after a Citi analysis says they should benefit from a focus on trade-down customers at the onset of another recession. Dollar stores are seeing wealthier shoppers: Customers making $70K-plus are the fastest growing segment at Dollar General (DG +1.6%), and average household income at Family Dollar (FDO +4.1%) is double from a decade ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • NKE

    Nike (NKE +4.7%) remains up strongly after yesterday's earnings beat. Healthy sales of...

    Nike (NKE +4.7%) remains up strongly after yesterday's earnings beat. Healthy sales of basketball shoes and lightweight running shoes contributed to impressive top-line growth, as did the solid performance of secondary brands. Sterne Agee sees Nike delivering innovative product launches ahead of the 2012 Olympics. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • YOKU

    Youku.com (YOKU +22.1%) rebounds sharply from yesterday's decline, after Susquehanna's Ming Zhao...

    Youku.com (YOKU +22.1%) rebounds sharply from yesterday's decline, after Susquehanna's Ming Zhao upgrades the Chinese video site to Positive and sets a $29 PT. Zhao sees Youku as a likely acquisition target, and names China Mobile (NYSE:CHL) and Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY) as potential buyers. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • VFC

    VF Corp. (VFC +5%) enjoys a boost from Bank of America, which upgrades its stock rating to...

    VF Corp. (VFC +5%) enjoys a boost from Bank of America, which upgrades its stock rating to Buy from Neutral on momentum in the retailer's higher-margin international and direct-to-consumer segments led by its North Face and Vans brands. VFC also could see greater-than-expected accretion from its recent acquisition of Timberland.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • TIBX

    Tibco Software (TIBX +5.1%) holds on to gains after reporting a 36% jump in FQ3 profits...

    Tibco Software (TIBX +5.1%) holds on to gains after reporting a 36% jump in FQ3 profits yesterday, easily beat estimates on strong sales growth in both of its main businesses. The company also guided FY12 to the higher end of the range, now expecting its EPS to come in between $0.93 to $0.95 versus expectations of $0.93.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • MS

    Pushed into action by rumors about exposure to European banks, Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS) CEO...

    Pushed into action by rumors about exposure to European banks, Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS) CEO Gorman yesterday had his traders buy the firm's debt in the open market. He also placed calls to 2 well-known analysts, explaining that Morgan's "net exposure" to French banks was "zero."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • DANG

    Chinese online retailer Dangdang (DANG +12.9%) pops after saying it started the operation of its...

    Chinese online retailer Dangdang (DANG +12.9%) pops after saying it started the operation of its Wuxi fulfillment center in late August, bringing its total warehouse space to 260K square meters. Separately, the company also announces the appointment Justin Changqing Xiong as its head of technology commencing September 20, 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • IONS

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS +2.9%) says it has filed a patent infringement lawsuit against...

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS +2.9%) says it has filed a patent infringement lawsuit against Santaris Pharma A/S based upon Santaris' activities providing antisense drugs and antisense drug discovery services to several pharmaceutical companies.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • HGIC

    Insurance company Harleysville Group (HGIC +26%) skies on a Bloomberg report it is in talks to...

    Insurance company Harleysville Group (HGIC +26%) skies on a Bloomberg report it is in talks to be acquired by Nationwide Financial.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 1 Comment

  • The CEO of the world's largest copper mining company says the freefall in copper prices may be...

    The CEO of the world's largest copper mining company says the freefall in copper prices may be ending. "You get the feeling it's hitting bottom...the supply and demand equation still remains tight," says Diego Hernandez of Chile's Codelco. Dr. Copper isn't cooperating just yet, down 4.5% at last check.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • CTRN

    Citi Trends (CTRN +2.6%) trades higher after announcing a number of cost cutting actions. The...

    Citi Trends (CTRN +2.6%) trades higher after announcing a number of cost cutting actions. The company plans to eliminate some positions in its corporate offices, distribution centers and store organization, and will pull back on its new store opening plans, only opening stores for which it has already made commitments.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • MS

    Big banks (XLF +0.8%) are some the day's best performers despite continued uncertainty about the...

    Big banks (XLF +0.8%) are some the day's best performers despite continued uncertainty about the debt situation in Europe. Leading the group is Morgan Stanley (MS +5.6%), after Bernstein's Brad Hintz says it faces less than $2B of risks linked French banks. Still, Morgan Stanley's CDS spreads hit 438 points earlier, up from 399 yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • RENN

    Renren (RENN +4%) gets a boost after Maxim Group upgrades the stock to hold on valuation with a...

    Renren (RENN +4%) gets a boost after Maxim Group upgrades the stock to hold on valuation with a $5.25 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • CPHD

    Cepheid (CPHD +4.8%) gets a boost from a Goldman upgrade to buy, noting the company's new...

    Cepheid (CPHD +4.8%) gets a boost from a Goldman upgrade to buy, noting the company's new product opportunities, increased global TB testing, and improved top-line growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • SCHL

    Education stocks are kicking into a higher gear today and recapturing some ground lost after...

    Education stocks are kicking into a higher gear today and recapturing some ground lost after suffering a wave of downgrades and declining enrollment. A reiterated Buy rating from Gabelli on Scholastic (SCHL -0.1%) - along with its earnings beat - may have kickstarted the second look at the sector. Gainers: DV +6.6%, OTC:NAUH +10%, STRA +4.2%, CECO +4.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • AMRS

    Amyris (AMRS +4.9%) pops after Piper Jaffray upgrades the stock to overweight, citing a...

    Amyris (AMRS +4.9%) pops after Piper Jaffray upgrades the stock to overweight, citing a potential earnings boost over the next three months from the consummation of a joint venture with Total (TOT +0.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • DISH

    Dish Network (DISH +4.6%) unveils its Blockbuster Movie Pass, a bundled combination of streaming...

    Dish Network (DISH +4.6%) unveils its Blockbuster Movie Pass, a bundled combination of streaming video, DVDs by mail and satellite subscription service. Netflix (NFLX +1.7%) may be relieved that the service for now is being bundled specifically for Dish Network satellite customers, rather than as a stand-alone streaming service.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • NFLX

    After rallying on Netflix's (NASDAQ:NFLX) guidance cut, Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) fell hard this...

    After rallying on Netflix's (NASDAQ:NFLX) guidance cut, Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) fell hard this week on worries about a massive hike in the fees it pays to Visa (NYSE:V) for debit transactions. But shares are up 5.5% today after D.A. Davidson's John Kraft comes to Coinstar's defense, arguing the company has options for offsetting the higher fees.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • CYTX

    Cytori Therapeutics (CYTX +6.7%) jumps after signing an agreement with private healthcare group...

    Cytori Therapeutics (CYTX +6.7%) jumps after signing an agreement with private healthcare group Apollo Hospitals to offer its Celution System at select Apollo cosmetic surgery centers in India.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • MNKD

    Shares of MannKind (MNKD +11%) go on a tear after the firm announces a plan to offer $370M in...

    Shares of MannKind (MNKD +11%) go on a tear after the firm announces a plan to offer $370M in senior secured discount notes to be used in part to develop Phase 3 clinical trials of its AFREZZA product. The move follows up last month's FDA clearance on late-stage trials for the inhaled insulin therapy.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • PNM

    PNM Resources (PNM +16.8%) shares soar after the New Mexico electricity distributor agrees...

    PNM Resources (PNM +16.8%) shares soar after the New Mexico electricity distributor agrees to sell its First Choice Power subsidiary for $270M, and will sell its stake in Optim Energy, exiting its Texas businesses. The company says it plans to use the money to buy back debt and its stock. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • MRVL

    Marvell Technology (MRVL +4.3%) shares rally on rumors the company's next-generation processors...

    Marvell Technology (MRVL +4.3%) shares rally on rumors the company's next-generation processors could be used in Apple's (AAPL +0.8%) future iPhones and iPads. ArsTechnica reports that developers saw support for Marvell's quad-core ARM Armada XP processor in Apple's Xcode.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • TSS

    Electronic payment processor Total System (TSS +0.9%) is higher today after JMP Securities ups...

    Electronic payment processor Total System (TSS +0.9%) is higher today after JMP Securities ups it to outperform. The firm cites potential business wins at Capital One (COF +0.4%) and Bank of America (BAC +4.5%) over the next 12-18 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM

  • Liquidation of the precious metals continues: Gold off more than $100/oz., -6% to $1,635. Silver...

    Liquidation of the precious metals continues: Gold off more than $100/oz., -6% to $1,635. Silver -16.8%, printing below $30/oz. at one point, now at $30.43. The metal has easily taken out its lows from the April/May panic selloff. Chartists might say, "where's the support?"

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 21 Comments
  • HMC

    Ford analyst George Pipas gives a sneak peek at Sept. U.S. auto sales numbers, saying the...

    Ford analyst George Pipas gives a sneak peek at Sept. U.S. auto sales numbers, saying the annualized rate is tracking at its best rate since April. Seemingly casting aside any recession worries, he adds that after Honda (HMC -0.5%) and Toyota (TM +0.9%) recover inventories by the end of Oct. there are "no excuses" for auto sales. Shares of F +2.3% and GM +2.9% are posting steady gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • RRC

    Shares of Range Resources (RRC -10.9%), riding high all week from takeover rumors, are today's...

    Shares of Range Resources (RRC -10.9%), riding high all week from takeover rumors, are today's biggest S&P losers after an appeals court ruling throws into question leases RRC and other energy companies hold to Marcellus shale-gas production rights. Also: COG -5.7%, CHK -2.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • PODD

    Insulet (PODD +1.9%) trades up after Wunderlich initiates the shares with a buy on valuation,...

    Insulet (PODD +1.9%) trades up after Wunderlich initiates the shares with a buy on valuation, saying the company's pending next-gen OmniPod launch will give it a competitive advantage to its peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • CVA

    Covanta Holding (CVA +4.7%) pops after increasing its share buyback by $100M, raising the...

    Covanta Holding (CVA +4.7%) pops after increasing its share buyback by $100M, raising the company's total repurchase authorization up to $400M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • OMN

    Specialty Chemical maker OMNOVA Solutions (OMN -4.4%) trades lower today after suspending...

    Specialty Chemical maker OMNOVA Solutions (OMN -4.4%) trades lower today after suspending production at its Taicang, China plant and consolidating operations into another facility in response to weak demand in its domestic and export furniture and automotive upholstery markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • RDN

    Radian Group (RDN +4%) re-aligns its operational structure in a bid to compete more effectively....

    Radian Group (RDN +4%) re-aligns its operational structure in a bid to compete more effectively. The company plans to focus its resources on sales and other core functions while aligning its support services to adjust to reduced mortgage market volume. The re-alignment includes a 7% reduction in workforce.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM

  • Gold is steepening its descent, now at $1,655/oz., -4.8% on the day. Traders point to hedge...

    Gold is steepening its descent, now at $1,655/oz., -4.8% on the day. Traders point to hedge funds - big buyers in the move up - now unloading positions. Until the past few days, gold has been about the only investment held by John Paulson's funds that hasn't been taken out behind the barn and shot.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 2 Comments
  • GPI

    Group 1 Automotive (GPI +2.4%) trades higher after Stifel Nicolaus initiates coverage with a...

    Group 1 Automotive (GPI +2.4%) trades higher after Stifel Nicolaus initiates coverage with a buy, citing a well-balanced product line, strong balance sheet and a management team committed to cutting costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • JKS

    Solar stocks are getting some needed relief today (TAN +3.1%), after nosediving much of this...

    Solar stocks are getting some needed relief today (TAN +3.1%), after nosediving much of this week on bad news from JinkoSolar (JKS -0.5%) and First Solar (FSLR +1.6%), and the ongoing uproar over Solyndra. SOL +7.2%. TSL +3.5%. LDK +2.6%. GTAT +3.2%. CSIQ +3.9%. JASO +2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • MT

    ArcelorMittal (MT +2%) gets a lift from management comments made at its investor day today. Its...

    ArcelorMittal (MT +2%) gets a lift from management comments made at its investor day today. Its CFO noted the balance sheet is in better shape than in 2008-09 and the company remains on track to reduce net debt to less than $ 22.5B by the middle of 2012 under various scenarios.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • ADES

    ADA-ES (ADES +30.4%) is skyrocketing on above-average volume. Shares could be getting a lift...

    ADA-ES (ADES +30.4%) is skyrocketing on above-average volume. Shares could be getting a lift from yesterday's announcement about the successful demonstration of the company's M45 technology for producing refined coal, though it's worth noting the announcement came during market hours, and shares closed lower on Thursday.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • QRVO

    Like other chip stocks, TriQuint (TQNT +7.2%) is moving higher following its Q3 guidance cut, as...

    Like other chip stocks, TriQuint (TQNT +7.2%) is moving higher following its Q3 guidance cut, as investors expecting a larger cut buy in. Kaufman (Buy) thinks the decline in AAPL orders could be a sign of reduced chip share in the iPhone 5 relative to the iPhone 4, but thinks it's more likely a result of the iPhone 3GS being discontinued.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • GLF

    Global Hunter ups ratings on several offshore oil services companies, saying global rig demand...

    Global Hunter ups ratings on several offshore oil services companies, saying global rig demand is benefiting from an opening up of U.S. permits. It raises Gulfmark Offshore (GLF -2.5%) to accumulate, and Hornbeck Offshore Services (HOS -3.8%), Noble (NE +4.4%), Oceaneering International (OII +1.3%) and Rowan (RDC +0.3%) to buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • RMBS

    Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) gains 6.5% after J.P. Morgan starts the memory technology firm at...

    Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) gains 6.5% after J.P. Morgan starts the memory technology firm at Overweight, and sets a $21 PT. Investors are eagerly anticipating a pending verdict in the company's antitrust suit against Micron (NASDAQ:MU) and Hynix. Closing arguments were made earlier this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • CBK

    Retailer Christopher & Banks (CBK -11.9%) gets hit after cutting its FQ2 forecast. It now...

    Retailer Christopher & Banks (CBK -11.9%) gets hit after cutting its FQ2 forecast. It now sees a bigger loss between $0.37 and $0.39 on sales of $96.2M, versus expectations for an EPS loss of $0.21 on sales of $102M. The company says markdowns hurt margins as customers spurned incremental price increases.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • AAL

    JPMorgan clears airline stocks for a takeoff, noting carriers are cash-heavy and profitable....

    JPMorgan clears airline stocks for a takeoff, noting carriers are cash-heavy and profitable. Analyst Jamie Baker says the historical 40% downturn in shares post-recession has already been cleared, and consolidation should help margins. Adding to the mix, recent guidance from airliners has been mainly positive. The NYSE Arca Airline Index is up 2.8%, led by LCC +4.5%, DAL +4.2%, UAL +4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • RSLS

    EnteroMedics (ETRM -9.1%) is down after closing out its secondary offering of 8.8M common shares...

    EnteroMedics (ETRM -9.1%) is down after closing out its secondary offering of 8.8M common shares and 1.76M warrants. It will use the proceeds from the sale to help fund the development of its Maestro RC System, which is used in the treatment of obesity, diabetes and hypertension.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • HPQ

    Hewlett-Packard (HPQ -5.3%) sinks to a six-year low $21.60/share, losing all the pop from the...

    Hewlett-Packard (HPQ -5.3%) sinks to a six-year low $21.60/share, losing all the pop from the Apotheker firing. Investors apparently are not thrilled that H-P looks to have decided to do pretty much what Apotheker was going to do anyway. On Meg Whitman, the concern is that she "faces a learning curve" in the enterprise business after 30 years in the consumer space (earlier).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • ALXN

    Shares of Alexion Pharamaceuticals (ALXN +3.4%) register a gain after the firm says it has...

    Shares of Alexion Pharamaceuticals (ALXN +3.4%) register a gain after the firm says it has received a positive opinion in Europe for Soliris with a final decision from the European Commission expected in about two months. Soliris is a first treatment for patients with a rare life-threatening blood disorder.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • NKE

    Earnings blowouts (I, II) from Nike (NKE +6.1%) and Finish Line (FINL +10%) are boosting the...

    Earnings blowouts (I, II) from Nike (NKE +6.1%) and Finish Line (FINL +10%) are boosting the shares of other shoe-related companies. Gainers: CROX +1%, DECK +2.6%, SKX +3.5%, FL +3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • WPM

    Silver miners continue to have a brutal week, as yesterday's huge decline in silver prices is...

    Silver miners continue to have a brutal week, as yesterday's huge decline in silver prices is followed up by an even larger drop today. SLW -3.7%. CDE -4.4%. SSRI -3.4%. EXK -4.3%. But some copper miners are rebounding a little, even as the metal sheds another 3.4%. FCX +0.9%. SCCO +1.3%. BHP +0.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 4 Comments
  • DIS

    A report saying Disney (NYSE:DIS) was one of the companies contacted to buy all or part of Yahoo...

    A report saying Disney (NYSE:DIS) was one of the companies contacted to buy all or part of Yahoo (YHOO +1.5%) isn't quite exciting investors. Shares of DIS are down 0.8% vs gains registering on major indices.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • AMSC

    American Superconductor (NASDAQ:AMSC) rises 19.5% after finally announcing its FY10 and FQ1 2011...

    American Superconductor (NASDAQ:AMSC) rises 19.5% after finally announcing its FY10 and FQ1 2011 results. While the numbers, which include restated results for FQ2 and FQ3 2010, are well below Street estimates, investors appear relieved they aren't worse. The announcement of $100M in new contracts could also be lifting shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM

  • Providing something resembling a lift to European shares are comments from Germany's hardline...

    Providing something resembling a lift to European shares are comments from Germany's hardline finmin Schaeuble that the 2nd Greek bailout may have to be revised. Schauble had previously threatened withholding additional funds from Greece if it didn't meet the July 21 targets. Stoxx 50 about 2% off the lows, -0.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • MCD

    Raymond James takes a shine to shares of McDonald's (NYSE:MCD), initiating shares with an...

    Raymond James takes a shine to shares of McDonald's (NYSE:MCD), initiating shares with an Outperform rating. Shares are up 0.4% premarket after outperforming the Dow yesterday and hiking its dividend last night.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • SIGA

    Premarket gainers: SIGA +15%. NKE +5%. CTIC +4%. YOKU +3%.Losers: FRO -7%. NBG -7%. CEF -6%. SLW...

    Premarket gainers: SIGA +15%. NKE +5%. CTIC +4%. YOKU +3%.
    Losers: FRO -7%. NBG -7%. CEF -6%. SLW -6%. ING -5%. MDW -4%. BBVA -4%. AUY -4%. MOS -4%. HL -4%. VE -4%. TOT -3%. ABX -3%. SDRL -3%. SAP -3%. ARMH -3%. TSM -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • FDX

    After a bloody day for FedEx (NYSE:FDX), Piper Jaffray pops in to maintain a $116 price target...

    After a bloody day for FedEx (NYSE:FDX), Piper Jaffray pops in to maintain a $116 price target and Overweight rating on shares. Analysts with the firm "tweaked" their estimate for EPS below the company's own FY12 guidance. Shares -1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM
  • VLTC

    Motricity (MOTR), a provider of mobile advertising and web portal solutions, gains 7.5%...

    Motricity (MOTR), a provider of mobile advertising and web portal solutions, gains 7.5% premarket after announcing it's received a $20M loan from Carl Icahn, and stating Icahn has a 14.6% stake in the company. Motricity also says it's hired a firm to explore strategic options, such as a spinoff or sale, and is "reviewing various financing options." (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • ALV

    Shares of Autoliv (NYSE:ALV) fall off 4.8% premarket after Moody's discloses a ratings change is...

    Shares of Autoliv (NYSE:ALV) fall off 4.8% premarket after Moody's discloses a ratings change is imminent.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Metallurgical coal prices could fall further, keeping pressure on coal stocks like Alpha Natural...

    Metallurgical coal prices could fall further, keeping pressure on coal stocks like Alpha Natural Resources (ANR) and Patriot Coal (PCX), according to analysts at Tudor Pickering Holt. Premarket: ANR -3.3%, PCX -3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • P

    Shares of Pandora (NYSE:P) are up 1.5% premarket after catching a needed upgrade from Morgan...

    Shares of Pandora (NYSE:P) are up 1.5% premarket after catching a needed upgrade from Morgan Stanley to Overweight from Equalweight on valuation. Morgan's $16 price target on shares stands in stark contrast to BTIG's mark of $3.75 - announced earlier this week and centered in part on Pandora's lack of Facebook integration.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM
  • MRVL

    Cavium (CAVM) is down 13.8% premarket following yesterday's warning. Roth's Arnab Chanda, who...

    Cavium (CAVM) is down 13.8% premarket following yesterday's warning. Roth's Arnab Chanda, who downgraded and cut estimates on the network processor firm ahead of its warning, is reiterating a Neutral, believing the full impact of a weak enterprise backdrop isn't factored into 2012 estimates, and the timing of key customer product ramps remains uncertain.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM
  • BAC

    In premarket trading, Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) breaks below $6 for the first time since March...

    In premarket trading, Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) breaks below $6 for the first time since March 2009. Shares -1.8% at $5.95. Not helping is South Korea's SWF denying a report it has decided to add to its 69M share stake.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMAC

    U.K.-based Turnstall Healthcare Group acquires American Medical Alert (NASDAQ:AMAC) for $8.55 a...

    U.K.-based Turnstall Healthcare Group acquires American Medical Alert (NASDAQ:AMAC) for $8.55 a share in a deal expected to close in Q4. Shares of AMAC shoot up 46% following the announcement.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM
  • MOS

    Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) drops 2.7% premarket after preannouncing FQ1 revenue of $3.1B (+41% Y/Y) and...

    Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) drops 2.7% premarket after preannouncing FQ1 revenue of $3.1B (+41% Y/Y) and EPS of $1.17, compared with a consensus of $2.9B and $1.27. The company's gross margin was 27.5%, up from 23.1% in the year-ago period, but down from 35% in FQ4. A full earnings release will arrive on Wednesday.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM
  • GLD

    Gold legs down below $1,700/oz. for the first time since early August. A technician might look...

    Gold legs down below $1,700/oz. for the first time since early August. A technician might look at a chart and say there is no support for the metal until $1,500. It was from this level on July 1 that gold took off in a straight line to $1,900 over the next 6 weeks. GLD -2.5% premarket.
